an3.143:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, at the monastery of the wanderers in the peacocks’ feeding ground.
an3.143:1.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
an3.143:2.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary from the yoke, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are the best among gods and humans.
an3.143:2.3: The entire spectrum of an adept’s ethics, immersion, and wisdom.
an3.143:2.4: A mendicant with these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary from the yoke, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are the best among gods and humans.”
